alert.note: Alert for Davidson; Rutherford; Williamson; Wilson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 2:17PM CDT by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Davidson, northwestern Rutherford, northeastern Williamson and southwestern Wilson Counties through 245 PM CDT... At 216 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Nippers Corner, or 8 miles southeast of Nashville, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Murfreesboro, Smyrna, Brentwood, La Vergne, Nolensville, Oak Hill, Rural Hill, Antioch, Berry Hill, Percy Priest Lake and Gladeville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 211 and 219. Interstate 65 between mile markers 71 and 80. Interstate 24 between mile markers 52 and 72. Interstate 840 between mile markers 55 and 73. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
